intro: Rhinocarpus, commonly known as the horned poppy, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Papaveraceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, horn-shaped seed pods that give it its common name. The plants typically have showy, colorful flowers that bloom in the spring or summer. Rhinocarpus species are native to various regions in the Mediterranean and parts of Asia. They are often found in rocky or dry habitats, and their botanical features make them interesting subjects for study in both horticulture and botany.
